lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/conversal.Conversal.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run conversal.Conversal.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

* Entry point of the Conversal chatbot application.

String input = ui.readInput();  // Read user input

* Represents a command to create and add a Deadline task
* The DeadlineCommand is created when the user input starts with "deadline ".
* It extracts the description and due date from the input,
* saves the updated list to Storage,
* and updates the user through Ui.
* Creates a DeadlineCommand using the user input.
* @param input the user input containing the description and due date of the deadline
* Executes the command to create and add a new Deadline task.
* If the description or due date are missing, or if the due date
* cannot be parsed into a valid LocalDate, a ConversalException is thrown.
* Else, the new task is added to the TaskList,
* the list is saved via Storage,
* and a confirmation message is displayed through Ui.
* @param tasks   the task list to add the new deadline into
* @param ui      the UI to show the confirmation message
* @throws ConversalException if the deadline description or date is missing or invalid
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Storage storage, Ui ui) throws ConversalException {
throw new ConversalException("Ah, I got it! " + ui.getInstructionDeadline());
throw new ConversalException("Ah, I got it! " + ui.getInstructionDeadline());
throw new ConversalException("Ah, I got it! " + ui.getInstructionDeadline());
throw new ConversalException("Ah, I got it! " + ui.getInstructionDeadline());

* Represents a Deadline task in the Conversal chatbot.
* A Deadline has a description and a due date.
* It is displayed with the task type symbol [D].
* Shows the formatted due date when listed.
* Creates a new Deadline task with the given description
* @param description description of the deadline task
* @param dueDate     the due date of the task
* Returns the due date of this deadline task.
* @return the due date as a LocalDate
* Returns the string representation of this Deadline.
* Includes the task description and the due date in the format
* @return the string form of this deadline task
* Represents an Event task in the Conversal chatbot.
* An Event has a description, a start time, and an end time.
* It is displayed with the task type symbol [E].
* Shows both the start and end schedule when listed.
* Creates a new Event task with the given description,
* @param start       the start date/time of the event
* @param end         the end date/time of the event
